page.title: 09ARABLE FARMING IN ELMBRIDGE
page.content: The mainarable crops are wheat and barley with a small amount of sugar beet, oil seed rape and potatoes. The crops are generally sold to local markets, feed merchants and also co-operatives. On the larger farms many of the hedges and odd trees have been removed to make the fields larger enabling the use of big machinery. The hedges surrounding the fields are generally cut by a pulverising machine Many of the farms are a family concern Contract labour is used quite often. The land is largely owned by the occupiers, except a four hundred acre unit which is rented from a pension fund. A nursery produces container grown shrubs for sale to the general public and landscape gardeners. A 70 acre fruit farm mainly produces apples which are stored in a refridgeration unit before they are sold.
